basic.description: Problems of maximization and minimization of functions of many variables when the variables are restricted by inequality constraints, with applications to resource allocation, technology, estimation theory, etc.; convex sets and their properties, convex functions; Lagrange multipliers and the Kuhn-Tucker theorem. (Offered jointly with MATH-434*.) Three term-hours, fall; lectures.
basic.subject: MATH
basic.title: Linear and Nonlinear Optimization
